byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Joseph Burgess, Jim Dwyer, Emma G. Fitzsimmons, Colin Moynihan, Benjamin Mueller, Sarah Maslin Nir, Patrick McGeehan, Tatiana Schlossberg, Liam Stack, John Surico, Kate Taylor and Alex Vadukul, and research by Susan C. Beachy.
byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and AL BAKER

abstract: Two apartment buildings collapse following large explosion in Manhattan's East Village; explosion ignites blaze that quickly spreads to neighboring buildings, resulting in injuries to at least 19 people; at least one person remains missing; Mayor Bill de Blasio says evidence points to plumbing and gas work being done nearby on Second Avenue.
lead_paragraph: A blast caused two buildings to collapse and left at least 19 people injured.

headline.main: East Village Explosion Ignites Fire, Fells Buildings and Injures at Least 19
headline.print_headline: East Village Blast and Fire Fell Buildings and Hurt at Least 19

snippet: A blast caused two buildings to collapse and left at least 19 people injured.
